sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"退下，退却"之意。
means: retire ： 指从公开或公共场合退下到私下场所，也指被免除职务或自动辞职、退役等。
retreat ： 含消极意味，多指被迫采取退下或退却的行动。
withdraw ： 侧重因某种原因而有意离开，常含礼貌、谦恭等理由。也指军队的撤退。

sentence.Network_en: If they prove ineffective they should be demoted or asked to retire.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果事实证明他们已无力胜任，应该将他们降级或让他们退休。

sentence.Network_en: The jury will retire to consider its verdict today.
sentence.Network_cn: 陪审团今天将退庭商议裁决结果。

sentence.Network_en: It would be nice to be able to afford to retire earlier.
sentence.Network_cn: 无后顾之忧而能提早退休当是件幸事。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'withdraw (to a place of safety or seclusion)'): from French retirer, from re- 'back' + tirer 'draw'

encyclopedia.content: 退休（retire ），是指根据国家有关规定，劳动者因年老或因工、因病致残，完全丧失劳动能力（或部分丧失劳动能力）而退出工作岗位。2011年1月起，我国对个人提前退休取得的一次性补贴收入，按照“工资、薪金所得”项目征收个人所得税。

entry.def: When older people retire, they leave their job and usually stop working completely.

example.ex: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career...
example.tran: 在大多数人都退休的年龄，他却准备好面对新的职业。

example.ex: Although their careers are important many said they plan to retire at 50...
example.tran: 虽然事业很重要，但很多人都说他们打算50岁退休。

entry.tran: （从体育运动中）退役;退出（比赛）
entry.def: When a sports player retires from their sport, they stop playing in competitions. When they retire from a race or a match, they stop competing in it.

example.ex: I have decided to retire from Formula One racing at the end of the season...
example.tran: 我已经决定在这个赛季末结束一级方程式赛车生涯。

example.ex: One of the most serious injuries was to Simon Littlejohn, who was forced to retire from the race with a leg injury.
example.tran: 伤势最重的人之一是西蒙·利特尔约翰，他腿部受伤，被迫退出了比赛。

entry.def: If you retire to another room or place, you go there.

example.ex: Eisenhower left the White House and retired to his farm in Gettysburg.
example.tran: 艾森豪威尔离开白宫，退隐到他在葛底斯堡的农场。

entry.def: When a jury in a court of law retires, the members of it leave the court in order to decide whether someone is guilty or innocent.

example.ex: The jury will retire to consider its verdict today.
example.tran: 陪审团今天将退庭商议裁决结果。

entry.def: When you retire, you go to bed.

example.ex: She retires early most nights, exhausted...
example.tran: 她大多数晚上都觉得精疲力尽，很早就睡了。

example.ex: Some time after midnight, he retired to bed.

means.word_mean: 1. go into retirement; stop performing one's work or withdraw from one's position;
3. pull back or move away or backward;

sentences.sentence: "The limo pulled away from the curb"

means.word_mean: 5. withdraw from circulation or from the market, as of bills, shares, and bonds
6. break from a meeting or gathering;

sentences.sentence: "The director was retired after the scandal"

means.word_mean: 8. dispose of; as of old clothes;

sentences.sentence: "he retired from life when his wife died"

means.word_mean: 10. cause to be out on a fielding play

sentences.sentence: "the runner was put out at third base"

means.word_mean: 12. go to bed in order to sleep;

sentences.sentence: "He turns out at the crack of dawn"

auth_sentence.content: We've decided to retire him as of today.
auth_sentence.res_content: We've decided to retire him as of today.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We've decided to retire him as of today.

auth_sentence.content: Employees then cash in their shares as they retire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Employees then cash in their shares as they retire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Employees then cash in their shares as they retire.

auth_sentence.content: Finally, at eighty-two, he had to retire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Finally, at eighty-two, he had to retire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Finally, at eighty-two, he had to retire.

Sentence.sentence: The Big Three American carmakers—General Motors, Ford and Chrysler—accumulated ruinous costs over the post-war years, such as gold-plated health plans and pensions for workers who retired as young as 48.
Yes, people are retiring even in this economy.
Some people want to make and save a lot of money in order to retire early.
Instead, Harrogate has become a popular town for people to retire to.
It is an ideal place for people to retire to
Sylvia and Paul Custerson, a retired couple from Cambridge, England, recently took a 16-day vacation to Namibia, where they went on bird-watching excursions.

sentences.en: Once people retire they automatically cease to be union members.
sentences.cn: 人们一旦退休就自动不再是工会会员。

sentences.en: Some of the older workers were retired early.
sentences.cn: 有些老工人提前退休了。

jushi.english: She retired early with a good book this night.
jushi.chinese: 今天晚上,她拿着一本好书很早就上床了。

jushi.english: Mr. Smith retired last month and now lives his ease.
jushi.chinese: 史密斯先生上月退休,现在过着平静的生活。

jushi.english: My wife usually retires at 10 o'clock.
